CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1955, pg. 16, reads: "'Youth on the March' - This was the impression one might have gained had he or she been in attendance at the first Youth Conference held at the Centre Avenue YMCA, April 23-24. The conference was sponsored by the Youth Department of the Branch, with Clarence Rogers Jr. serving as general chairman and Delores Gary secretary.  Jody Harris, acting boys' work secretary of the "YM," supervised the Planning Committee which did an excellent job.  Theme of the conference was "As the Walls Come Tumbling Down," and the 110 delegates from various high schools throughout the area were constantly reminded of the preparation required to meet the demands of integration in employment and social living.  Saturday evening at the banquet, the delegates heard an inspiring address by Atty. James B. Simmons Jr., City Councilman of Toledo, Ohio.  Upper left, the speakers' table at the banquet, left to right, Mr. Harris, the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, pastor of Wesley Center AME Zion Church, where the banquet was held; Mr. Rogers, Miss Beverly Butler, dynamic toastmistress; LeRoy Titus, who introduced the guest speaker; Attorney and Mrs. Simmons, the Rev. Augustus C. Sumpter of St. James AME Church, and Mrs. [Mr.] and Mrs. James M. Burgette, the latter being the executive secretary of the Centre Avenue YMCA... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jody Harris, Rev. Charles H. Foggie, Clarence Rogers Jr., Beverly Butler, LeRoy Titus, Atty. James Simmons Jr., Mrs. Simmons, Rev. Augustus C. Sumpter, Mrs. Burgette, and James M. Burgette seated at banquet table for Youth Conference, Wesley Center AME Zion Church
